flawed_nl_solution:
Jose has half as many bottles of domestic wine as imported wine, or 2400/2=<<2400/2=2100>>2100 bottles of domestic wine.
In total, he has 2400+2100=<<2400+2100=4500>>4500 bottles of wine.
If the guests drink one-third of all his wine, then they will have consumed 4500/3=<<4500/3=1500>>1500 bottles of wine.
Thus, after the party, Jose's private cellar will have 4500-1500=<<4500-1500=3000>>3000 remaining bottles of wine.
#### 3000

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 1200, not 2100. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
